item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Friday, September 6, 2024 at 10:15 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Did Sandia use a thermonuclear secondary in a product logo? (162 points | 22 comments)
2. Swift is a more convenient Rust (38 points | 9 comments)
3. Intent to unship: HTTP/2 Push (24 points | 2 comments)
4. What happens when you touch a pickle to an AM radio tower (107 points | 31 comments)
5. Understanding the Y Combinator (14 points | 5 comments)
6. LwIP – Lightweight IP Stack (93 points | 38 comments)
7. UE5 Nanite in WebGPU (332 points | 95 comments)
8. Phind-405B and faster, high quality AI answers for everyone (273 points | 113 comments)
9. The expected value of the game is positive regardless of Ballmer’s strategy (134 points | 99 comments)
10. Oxford commercializes its 20% more powerful solar panels in the US (34 points | 11 comments)
11. AlphaProteo generates novel proteins for biology and health research (271 points | 89 comments)
12. Summing Blue Noise Octaves Like Perlin Noise (18 points | 1 comment)
13. The One-Eyed Man Is King: How did the monocle become a symbol of wealth? (5 points | discuss)
14. Speeding up Electron apps by using V8 snapshots in the main process (41 points | 31 comments)
15. The origins of the steam engine (2023) (58 points | 7 comments)
16. Mozilla introduces updates to tab management in Firefox (37 points | 17 comments)
17. Deploying rust in existing firmware codebases (152 points | 82 comments)
18. Show HN: Retronews – TUI for HN and Lobsters emulating classical Usenet readers (36 points | 14 comments)
19. Serverless-registry: A Docker registry backed by Workers and R2 (148 points | 60 comments)
20. Ask HN: Resources for GPU Compilers? (57 points | 15 comments)
21. Cron Jobs on Linux – Comprehensive Guide with Examples (51 points | 18 comments)
22. Launch HN: Maitai (YC S24) – Self-Optimizing LLM Platform (127 points | 70 comments)
23. Show HN: We built a FOSS documentation CMS with a pretty GUI (110 points | 19 comments)
24. Common food dye found to make skin and muscle temporarily transparent (226 points | 83 comments)
25. Show HN: AnythingLLM – Open-Source, All-in-One Desktop AI Assistant (254 points | 63 comments)
26. Clojure 1.12.0 is now available (268 points | 56 comments)
27. The 'Freakish Radio Writings' of 1924 (59 points | 6 comments)
28. Study: Playing D&D helps autistic players in social interactions (6 points | 2 comments)
29. The work you do, the person you are (2017) (49 points | 19 comments)
30. Exercise has 2M users but no money in the bank (73 points | 54 comments)
